trans-unit.source: Identifies the start or end of story composed of one or more <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment"></xref> elements.
trans-unit.target: Identifica o início ou fim do bloco composto de uma ou mais <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment"> </xref> elementos.

trans-unit.source: A StoryBreak can only be a child element of a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>.
trans-unit.target: Um StoryBreak só pode ser um elemento subordinado do <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>.</xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>

trans-unit.source: Additionally, a StoryBreak can only be the first child, last child, or both the first and last child elements in a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>.
trans-unit.target: Além disso, um StoryBreak só pode ser o primeiro subordinado, o último subordinado ou ambos os elementos subordinados primeiro e último no <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>.</xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>

trans-unit.source: The location of the StoryBreak element in a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment> indicates if the story is contained in additional fragments, and if the additional fragments either precede or follow the current fragment.
trans-unit.target: A localização do elemento StoryBreak num <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>indica se o bloco está contido em fragmentos adicionais e os fragmentos adicionais preceder ou seguem o fragmento atual.</xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>

trans-unit.source: A StoryBreak as the first element in a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment> indicates the start of a story.
trans-unit.target: Um StoryBreak como o primeiro elemento num <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>indica o início de uma história.</xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>

trans-unit.source: ``` <!-- Fragment 1 --> <StoryFragment> <StoryBreak /> <!-- Identifies the start of a story when --> <!-- immediately after an opening <StoryFragment>. --> <ParagraphStructure> <NamedElement NameReference="a" /> <NamedElement NameReference="b" /> </ParagraphStructure> </StoryFragment> <!-- Story continues in the next <StoryFragment>. --> ``` A StoryBreak as the last element in a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment> indicates the end of a story.
trans-unit.target: ``` <!-- Fragment 1 --> <StoryFragment> <StoryBreak /> <!-- Identifies the start of a story when --> <!-- immediately after an opening <StoryFragment>. --> <ParagraphStructure> <NamedElement NameReference="a" /> <NamedElement NameReference="b" /> </ParagraphStructure> </StoryFragment> <!-- Story continues in the next <StoryFragment>. --> ```Um StoryBreak como o último elemento num <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>indica o fim de uma história.</xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>

trans-unit.source: ``` <!-- Fragment 2 --> <StoryFragment> <!-- Story continued from prior <StoryFragment>. --> <ParagraphStructure> <NamedElement NameReference="c" /> </ParagraphStructure> <StoryBreak /> <!-- Identifies the end of a story when --> <!-- immediately before a closing </StoryFragment>. --> </StoryFragment> ``` A story that is contained in a single <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment> will have two StoryBreak elements as the first and last child elements of the fragment.
trans-unit.target: ``` <!-- Fragment 2 --> <StoryFragment> <!-- Story continued from prior <StoryFragment>. --> <ParagraphStructure> <NamedElement NameReference="c" /> </ParagraphStructure> <StoryBreak /> <!-- Identifies the end of a story when --> <!-- immediately before a closing </StoryFragment>. --> </StoryFragment> ```Um bloco que está contido numa única <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>terá dois elementos StoryBreak como os elementos subordinados primeiro e último do fragmento.</xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>

trans-unit.source: ``` <!-- Fragments 1 and 2 Merged --> <ParagraphStructure> <NamedElement NameReference="a" /> <NamedElement NameReference="b" /> <NamedElement NameReference="c" /> </ParagraphStructure> ``` <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment> elements that are entirely contained on one page will start and end with StoryBreak elements since the content is completely contained in a single fragment.
trans-unit.target: ``` <!-- Fragments 1 and 2 Merged --> <ParagraphStructure> <NamedElement NameReference="a" /> <NamedElement NameReference="b" /> <NamedElement NameReference="c" /> </ParagraphStructure> ``` <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>os elementos que estão completamente incluídos numa página irão começar e terminar com StoryBreak elementos, uma vez que o conteúdo está completamente contido um fragmento único.</xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>

trans-unit.source: The position of StoryBreak elements in a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment> is useful when you want to access content in either forward or reverse direction in the document.
trans-unit.target: A posição de elementos StoryBreak um <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>é útil quando pretende aceder a conteúdo em direção direta ou inversa no documento.</xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>

trans-unit.source: For example when merging fragments in forward order, a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment> that ends with a StoryBreak indicates the end of the story and that there are no more fragments to merge.
trans-unit.target: Por exemplo quando intercalar os fragmentos de ordem de pesquisa direta, um <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>que termina com um StoryBreak indica o bloco final e que não existem nenhum mais fragmentos de intercalação.</xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>

trans-unit.source: Similarly when merging story fragments in reverse order, a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment> that starts with a StoryBreak indicates the start of the story and that there are no prior fragments to merge.
trans-unit.target: Da mesma forma quando história intercalar os fragmentos de ordem inversa, um <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>que começa com um StoryBreak indica o início do bloco e que não existem nenhum fragmentos anteriores para intercalação.</xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>

trans-unit.source: The ability to process story fragments in either forward or reverse directions is important for many application uses.
trans-unit.target: A capacidade de processar fragmentos do bloco nas direções direta ou inversa é importante para muitas utilizações de aplicação.

trans-unit.source: For example, a paragraph that spans page breaks is divided into multiple story fragments, one fragment for each page.
trans-unit.target: Por exemplo, um parágrafo que abrange as quebras de página está dividido em várias fragmentos de bloco, um fragmento para cada página.

trans-unit.source: A user interface that provides a triple-click feature to select and copy a whole paragraph to the clipboard must be able to merge multiple story fragments when a paragraph spans multiple pages.
trans-unit.target: Uma interface de utilizador que fornece uma funcionalidade de triple-clique para selecionar e copiar um parágrafo todo para a área de transferência tem de conseguir intercalar vários fragmentos do bloco quando um parágrafo abrange várias páginas.

trans-unit.source: Additionally if the user triple-clicks on part of a paragraph that starts on the first page, the application must identify that the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment> starts with a StoryBreak but does not end with a StoryBreak.
trans-unit.target: Além disso se o utilizador triple-cliques na parte de um parágrafo que começa na primeira página, a aplicação tem de identificar que a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>começa com um StoryBreak mas não terminar com um StoryBreak.</xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>

trans-unit.source: This would indicate that the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment> that is contained on the next page must be loaded and added to the end of the current fragment.
trans-unit.target: Isto poderia indicar que o <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>que está contido no próximo página tem de ser carregada e adicionada ao final do fragmento atual.</xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>

trans-unit.source: Similarly if the user triple-clicks on part of the paragraph located on the last page, the application must identify that the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment> ends with a StoryBreak but does not begin with a StoryBreak.
trans-unit.target: Da mesma forma se o utilizador triple-cliques na parte do parágrafo localizado na última página, a aplicação tem de identificar que a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>termina com um StoryBreak mas não começa com um StoryBreak.</xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>

trans-unit.source: This would indicate that the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment> that is contained on previous page must be loaded and added to the start of the current fragment.
trans-unit.target: Isto poderia indicar que o <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>que está contida na página anterior tem de ser carregado e adicionado no início do fragmento atual.</xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>

trans-unit.source: The application should also be able to process both forward and reverse directions for the case of large paragraphs that span three or more pages and where the user's selection point is on an inner page.
trans-unit.target: A aplicação deve também conseguir processar direções direta e inversa para o caso de grandes dimensões parágrafos que abrangem três ou mais páginas e em que a seleção do utilizador ponto é uma página interna.

trans-unit.source: Since a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment> is limited to a single page, the use of StoryBreak elements allow each <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment> to contain well-formed XML but still have a hierarchical structure across an entire document.
trans-unit.target: Uma vez que um <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>está limitado a uma única página, a utilização de StoryBreak elementos permitem cada <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>contém um XML corretamente formado, mas continuará a ter uma estrutura hierárquica através de um documento de todo.</xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment> </xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>

trans-unit.source: Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryBreak"></xref> class.
trans-unit.target: Inicializa uma nova instância do <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryBreak"> </xref> classe.
